questions.text: A 60-year-old man with well-controlled hypertension undergoes echocardiographic evaluation. His left ventricular pressure-volume loop is as shown below. Based on this, what is the estimated ejection fraction (EF)?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 60%

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The ejection fraction is a critical measure of systolic function and is calculated as the ratio of stroke volume to end-diastolic volume. A normal EF typically ranges from 50% to 70% , with 60% considered a healthy midpoint. Values below this range may suggest varying degrees of heart failure. ​
  • ➤ ejection fraction
  • ➤ 50% to 70%
  • ➤ 60%

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding Laryngeal Mask Airways (LMAs) are correct? LMA placement requires neuromuscular blockade for successful insertion. LMAs provide a secure airway and can be used for both spontaneous and controlled ventilation. LMAs do not completely protect against aspiration, as they do not seal off the esophagus completely. LMAs are contraindicated in patients with an increased risk of regurgitation, such as pregnant women or those with bowel obstruction. LMAs should always be removed while the patient is deeply anesthetized to prevent airway complications.
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 2, 3, and 4 are correct

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ LMAs are useful airway devices that do not require muscle relaxation , allow for spontaneous and controlled ventilation , but do not fully protect against aspiration . They should be removed when the patient is awake to avoid complications.
  • ➤ do not require muscle relaxation
  • ➤ spontaneous and controlled ventilation
  • ➤ do not fully protect against aspiration
  • ➤ removed when the patient is awake

questions.text: In a nested case-control study investigating the association between long-term exposure to occupational stress and the development of chronic anxiety disorders, researchers use baseline data for exposure assessment. What analytical approach should be prioritized to enhance the interpretability of the results concerning the development of new cases?

options.label: A
options.text: Conditional logistic regression to match cases and controls on exposure duration

options.label: B
options.text: Cross-sectional analysis at the point of case identification

options.label: C
options.text: Prospective cohort analysis excluding the nested case-control component

options.label: D
options.text: Multivariate regression adjusting for potential confounders like age, job type, and baseline stress levels

questions.correct_answer: A. Conditional logistic regression to match cases and controls on exposure duration
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Conditional logistic regression to match cases and controls on exposure duration

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In nested case-control studies assessing the relationship between chronic exposures (such as occupational stress) and health outcomes (like anxiety disorders), conditional logistic regression is crucial. This method effectively matches cases and controls on exposure duration and adjusts for potential confounders, providing a robust analytical approach that enhances the interpretability of the causal relationships investigated.
  • ➤ In nested case-control studies assessing the relationship between chronic exposures (such as occupational stress) and health outcomes (like anxiety disorders), conditional logistic regression is crucial.
  • ➤ This method effectively matches cases and controls on exposure duration and adjusts for potential confounders, providing a robust analytical approach that enhances the interpretability of the causal relationships investigated.

questions.text: A 47-year-old cattle farmer presents with complaints of intermittent fever, malaise, and joint pain persisting for several years. He reports occupational exposure to livestock and unpasteurized dairy products. Chronic brucellosis is suspected based on clinical history and confirmatory exposure risk. Which of the following serological tests is least useful in diagnosing chronic brucellosis in this patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Standard agglutination test

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In chronic brucellosis , diagnostic tests should focus on detecting non-agglutinating IgG antibodies ; hence, Standard Agglutination Test is less useful , while 2-Mercaptoethanol , complement fixation , and Coombs' test are more appropriate.
  • ➤ chronic brucellosis
  • ➤ non-agglutinating IgG antibodies
  • ➤ Standard Agglutination Test is less useful
  • ➤ 2-Mercaptoethanol
  • ➤ complement fixation
  • ➤ Coombs' test

questions.text: A 42-year-old woman presents with continuous urinary leakage following a total abdominal hysterectomy performed 2 weeks ago. Physical examination reveals a moist vaginal vault. A methylene blue 3-swab test is performed, during which methylene blue dye is instilled into the bladder, and three sterile swabs are placed in the vaginal canal. After 30 minutes, the uppermost swab is found to be wet but not stained, while the other two swabs remain dry and unstained. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Ureterovaginal fistula

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The methylene blue 3-swab test helps localize urinary fistulas. A wet, unstained upper swab suggests a ureterovaginal fistula , while blue-stained middle or lower swabs suggest vesicovaginal or urethrovaginal fistulas, respectively.
  • ➤ methylene blue 3-swab test
  • ➤ wet, unstained upper swab
  • ➤ ureterovaginal fistula
  • ➤ blue-stained middle or lower swabs

questions.text: A 27-year-old Rh-negative pregnant woman at 28 weeks of gestation is undergoing evaluation for Rh immunoprophylaxis. She has no prior alloimmunization and her indirect Coombs test is negative. Which of the following clinical situations does not require administration of anti-D immunoglobulin?

options.label: B
options.text: Manual removal of placenta following vaginal delivery

options.label: C
options.text: Intrauterine transfusion at 28 weeks for fetal anemia

options.label: D
options.text: Medical termination of pregnancy at 63 days gestation

questions.correct_answer: C. Intrauterine transfusion at 28 weeks for fetal anemia
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Intrauterine transfusion at 28 weeks for fetal anemia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Anti-D immunoglobulin is indicated for Rh-negative women in situations where feto-maternal hemorrhage can occur, except in procedures like intrauterine transfusion beyond 28 weeks, where fetal red cells are not introduced into maternal circulation.
  • ➤ procedures like intrauterine transfusion

questions.text: Which of the following biochemical conversions is not dependent on biotin?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Gamma-carboxylation of glutamate residues

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Biotin (vitamin B7) is a coenzyme required for carboxylation reactions such as in gluconeogenesis, fatty acid synthesis, and amino acid metabolism. Gamma-carboxylation of glutamate residues, however, is a vitamin K–dependent process, not involving biotin.

questions.text: A 30-year-old primigravida at 39 weeks gestation is undergoing continuous electronic fetal monitoring during labor. The fetal heart rate tracing pattern is shown below. Which of the following conditions is most commonly associated with the pattern seen in this tracing?

options.label: D
options.text: Normal fetal response during active labor

questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Umbilical cord compression

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Variable decelerations on fetal heart rate monitoring are most commonly due to umbilical cord compression and are identified by their abrupt onset, variable shape, and inconsistent relationship with contractions.
  • ➤ Variable decelerations
  • ➤ umbilical cord compression

questions.text: A 67-year-old postmenopausal woman presents with abnormal vaginal bleeding for the past 2 months. MRI of the pelvis reveals a mass in the endometrial cavity invading more than 50% of the myometrium. The tumor extends to involve the upper vagina. However, there is no radiological evidence of lymph node involvement (pelvic or para-aortic). What is the most appropriate FIGO 2023 stage of her endometrial carcinoma?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) III B

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Endometrial carcinoma extending to the vagina but without nodal involvement is staged as FIGO Stage IIIB , reflecting direct extension to vaginal or parametrial structures without regional lymph node metastasis.
  • ➤ vagina
  • ➤ nodal involvement
  • ➤ FIGO Stage IIIB
  • ➤ direct extension to vaginal or parametrial structures

questions.text: A patient with stable angina is started on a newly prescribed medication. Shortly after initiation, he reports transient visual disturbances, describing luminous phenomena (e.g., bright halos or flashing lights). Which of the following medications was most likely started?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Ivabradine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ivabradine is an anti-anginal drug that reduces heart rate via inhibition of the funny current in the SA node and is associated with visual side effects, such as phosphenes or luminous visual phenomena.
  • ➤ Ivabradine is an anti-anginal drug that reduces heart rate via inhibition of the funny current in the SA node and is associated with visual side effects, such as phosphenes or luminous visual phenomena.

questions.text: A public health consultant is assessing strategies to sustain the elimination of lymphatic filariasis in a previously endemic area. Which intervention would be most effective in preventing the re-establishment of the disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Conduct annual mass drug administration in the region.

options.label: C
options.text: Provide ongoing public education about filariasis transmission and prevention.

options.label: D
options.text: Initiate genetic modification programs for mosquito populations.

questions.correct_answer: B. Establish permanent vector control measures.
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Establish permanent vector control measures.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Permanent vector control measures are essential for maintaining disease elimination, particularly for vector-borne diseases, by directly limiting the potential for disease transmission.

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding common causes of vaginal discharge are correct? Bacterial vaginosis is characterized by a positive whiff test and the presence of clue cells on wet mount. Trichomoniasis presents with thin, frothy, greenish-yellow discharge and is associated with motile flagellates on wet mount. Vulvovaginal candidiasis typically presents with curdy white discharge and vaginal pH >5. Bacterial vaginosis is usually non-irritating and is treated with oral metronidazole. The first-line treatment for candidiasis includes fluconazole or intravaginal clotrimazole.
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Statements 1, 2, 4 and 5 are correct

questions.text: A 2-year-old child weighing 10 kg is brought to the clinic with signs of xerophthalmia and night blindness. The physician suspects vitamin A deficiency. What is the most appropriate therapeutic dose of vitamin A for treating this child?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 200,000 IU

questions.text: A 76-year-old man, recently diagnosed with acute myeloid leukemia (AML), presents to the emergency department with worsening breathlessness and lethargy. He has no fever or chest pain. On examination, he is tachypneic with an SpO₂ of 90% on room air, RR 24/min, and bilateral coarse crackles on auscultation. Chest X-ray is done and it is shown. Laboratory values are: What is the most appropriate immediate intervention?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Leukapheresis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ AML patients with hyperleukocytosis and symptoms of leukostasis require urgent cytoreduction. When induction chemotherapy cannot be immediately administered, leukapheresis combined with hydroxyurea is the preferred temporizing strategy to prevent respiratory failure, CNS deterioration, and death.
  • ➤ leukapheresis combined with hydroxyurea
